title: SPF - Responses
head:
<link rel="stylesheet" name="roboto" href="//fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Roboto:300,600,900|Roboto+Condensed:300,300italic,400,700|Inconsolata:400">

body.content:
Documentation

  1. Get Started
  2. Responses
  3. Events
  4. Resources
  5. Versioning
  6. Features
    1. Caching
    2. Multipart Responses
    3. Prefetching

Responses

An overview of SPF responses and how they are processed.

In dynamic navigation, SPF updates the page with content from the response. SPF will do this processing in the following order:

  1. title — Update document title
  2. url — Update document URL
  3. head — Install early JS and CSS
  4. attr — Set element attributes
  5. body — Set element content and install JS and CSS
  6. foot — Install late JS and CSS

Note: All fields are optional and the commonly needed response values are title, head, body, and foot.

A response is typically in the following format:

{
  "title": "Page Title",
  "head":
      "<style>CSS Text</style>
       <!-- and/or -->
       <link href=\"CSS URL\" rel=\"stylesheet\">
       ...",
  "body": {
    "DOM ID 1": "HTML Text...",
    "DOM ID 2": "..."
  },
  "foot":
      "<script>JS Text</script>
       <!-- and/or -->
       <script src=\"JS URL\"></script>
       ..."
}

This pattern follows the general good practice of "styles in the head, scripts at the end of the body". The "foot" field represents the "end of the body" section without requiring developers to create an explicit element.

To update specific element attributes, the response format is as follows:

{
  "attr": {
    "DOM ID 1": {
      "Name 1": "Value 1",
      "Name 2": "Value 2"
    },
    "DOM ID 2":  {
      "...": "..."
    }
  }
}

Get Started

Use SPF on your site: send requests, return responses.

Events

Handle SPF events and the navigation life cycle.

If you have feedback, comments, or questions about SPF, please send them to spfjs@googlegroups.com. If you have bugs or feature requests, please file them on GitHub. Join our mailing list and follow @spfjs on Twitter for updates.
